text: One tap @Rattle N Hum. Yupp, quite dunkel and deep this. Dark cloudy charcoal colored with a hefty lacing grey head. It smells just like sesame oil. A by all means I really love the Asian smell, but in a dunkel weisse? Super strange. The sesame oily is overwhelming everything elsewhere and I get nothing but it. The taste however is much more like a relatively normal dunkel weisse. Yeasty banana, its nice and dark malty. About average on the carbonation and a good oily texture. Soft chocolate wrapper and a little bit of bitter cocoa in the finish. Ripe fruits and dry licorice pastilles. Strange but I kinda like it more and more down the glass. 17.06.2015
Pours rich brown. Aroma is alcohol, dark fruit pulp, wood and cocoa. Very complicated. Maybe thats why theyre leaving Texas.

Draft. Crystal clear dark brown body atop medium beige head. Aroma is moderately sweet, cocoa, some hot pepper, light caramel. Taste is moderately sweet, caramel, orange, some milk chocolate, light habanero. Sticky medium-full body.

Draught at Apex, PortlandDark brown color. Dusty aroma, caramel. Overly sweet caramel flavor, with low bitterness, and that stale character of American Dunkelweisse; quite fruity though. There is some alcohol perception.Difficult to drink, cloying.
Dark reddish brown... Banana nut bread on nose... Flavor is bananas, cloves, spices, chocolate, dark fruits...Great beer
Pours a dark amber color with a white head. Malt, caramel, banana, fruit, yeast, spice and chocolate aroma and flavors. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Fruit, wheat and clove finish.
On tap at Final Gravity. Pours Dark brown with a thick tan head and a chocolate aroma. There is a medium-bodied saeet chocolate flavor with some banana ester and a chewy finish.

On tap @ Bear Republic. Pours thin very dark brown with thin light mocha head. Aroma is dry chocolate malt with slight oaky notes on the back. Taste is clean, light chocolate malt up front, then dry and more chocolate on the finish. Surprisingly hop-free for a winter warmer. Good chocolate flavor though.
Tap at brewery. A dark brown color with a tan head. A nice chocolate aroma with malts. A slightly sweet and sour chocolate flavor.

On draft at Tap 25. I was surprised this was listed as a Dunkelweizen. It pours a dark reddish brown with an off white head. The aroma is veyr toasted with some chocolate and cherry cola. The flavor is rich with heavy dark fruits, raisins and plum with a dense bready malt background and cocoa. It has a nice herbal, raisin finish. Warming and tasty. Seems more like a Dunkler Bock to me. Not a lot of yeast character.
Aroma of banana, cocoa, grass. Dark brown. Heavily lacing beige head. Taste is sweet and fruity with a hint of sharpness. Medium bodied. Pretty good.
Draft - Banana and cocoa. Jet brown with a rich brown head. Banana and chocolate syrup. No bitterness and a banana yeast finish. Nice winter warmer.

On draught at Lord Hobo, 1/16/14Deep cocoa-colored body is mostly opaque, with a small, but fairly well retained beige colored head.Nose begins very chocolatey (dark chocolate, cocoa powder) with some esters from the yeast mixing with it to produce a slight vinousness that balances the chocolatey sweetness well. With warming, you get a more dry molasses and banana note, with some wheat-like dryness as well. Still, the chocolate is quite strong here, I wouldnt say unbalanced, but it dosent seem like a dunkelweizen with just a touch of chocolate. Moderate to moderately strong aroma is pleasant and lasting.Initially, the chocolate flavor, while authentic, is quite rich and somewhat overpowering. Oily, almost bitter cacao notes are present, but the rich, sweet sugar is more dominant. Velvety, somewhat slick mouthfeel shows moderate carbonation and fortunately as it warms, the sweetness becomes more bearable (which is definitely not always the case). Yeast phenols and light malts attempt to balance, while the alcohol helps dry things a touch. Very rich, warming beer (this is a winter warmer, afterall) that is enjoyable, if somewhat slightly overdone on the chocolate sweetness.
On draft. Aroma of ripe fruit. Flavors of raisin, licorice, cherries and a thin chocolate finish. Chewy. Slightly sticky on the palate, esp as it warms. Alcohol present.

On tap @ Hopyard Pleasanton. Dark cola pour with a khaki head. Aromas of banana, roast, and cocoa powder. A lot of sweet fruit, caramel, and some tart plum. Sweet cola flavor, lots of banana, and clove. Roasted malt, cocoa, light coffee, and dark fruits. A bit tart on the finish.

On tap at Bear Republic, pours a deep dark mahogany with a medium beige / tan head. Aroma brings out a mix of cinnamon and cocoa, and toasted dry caramel malt. Flavour is similar, bringing out cocoa nibs, a little cinnamon, and toasted caramel. Full-bodied and creamy, with lots of flavour. Everything is in perfect harmony and it drinks very easily.

On tap at the brewery , pours a dark black pour with a small head. Nose is deep chocolate and dark roasted espresso. Taste is all chocolate and banana, like drinking a banana split. Finishes as it tastes, a real liquid treat . Quaff Score 8 / 10

On tap at Bear Republic in Healdsburg. Pours black with a tan head and aroma of sweet chocolate and banana. Taste is delicious, sweet cocoa and milk chocolate complimented by lots of banana and spices leading to a smooth finish. Excellent, tasty brew
Colour is dark brown with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Chocolate, grain, sweetness and malts.

On tap at TAPS in Petaluma. Pours strangely dark brown, nearly black with a tan head. Aroma is powdered cocoa, vanilla, molasses and banana. Flavor has some more toasted bready malts, a hint of clove and a thick banana pudding sweetness. too heavy and sweet.

Pours murky and brown. Small head. Im normally pretty easy on appearance but this one is sorta ugly. Looks thick. Smells sweet with molasses, caramel, dough, milk chocolate, but theres also a funny medicinal note that Im not enjoying. Taste is quite sweet in a cough syrup like way. Lots of that band aid flavor in the finish. Kind of a gummy, syrupy feel. Im just not a fan of this beer. The flavor combination doesnt work for me. It needs some sort of a balancing note at the very least. An unusual miss from bear republic.
From tap. Aroma of chocolate and malt. Hazy brown pour. Tastes of Belgian yeast, chocolate, and spices.
Draft. Dark brown beer with a cream head. Chocolate aroma. Chooclate and light wheat flavor. Medium bodied. Chooclate and light wheat lingers with light banana and light spice.
Winter, warmer. Brown pour with tiny tan head medium body. Chocolate/ mexican chocolate. Perfectly toasted malts. mellow  and dry.   Clean and easy to drink.

Tap @ Holiday Ale Fest...  Poured dark brown with a thin head.  Lots of cocoa and yeast spices.  Cloves, and a little bit drying.  Some fruitiness too.  Evan a natural hint of herbalness with some strong banana yeast flavors.
